meta.title: Paws of Wrath: A Sanctuary's Secret
meta.intro_text: The Paws & Whiskers Sanctuary, a haven for rescued animals, awoke to a grim discovery. Eleanor Vance, the shelter's formidable and wealthy owner, was found dead in her private office, an ornate, heavy ceremonial dog leash discarded nearby. The sanctuary, usually a place of solace, now hums with unspoken tension. Detectives have cordoned off the scene, and three individuals who were present in the building last night are the primary focus of the investigation. The clock is ticking to uncover the truth behind Eleanor's demise before more secrets are buried.

solution.motive: Eleanor Vance was in the process of disinheriting Arthur Finch after discovering his attempts to siphon funds from the sanctuary. He overheard her discussing the changes to her will, leading to a confrontation where he fatally struck her with the ceremonial dog leash.

outcomes.success: You've successfully unraveled the tangled web of deceit and brought Eleanor Vance's killer to justice. The Paws & Whiskers Sanctuary can begin to heal, its animals safe once more.
outcomes.failure: Your accusation missed the mark. The true killer walks free, and the sanctuary remains under the shadow of suspicion. The animals, and Eleanor's legacy, are left to an uncertain fate.
outcomes.timeout: Time has run out, and the killer has slipped away into the night. The truth remains hidden, leaving the sanctuary and its inhabitants without closure, the mystery forever unsolved.

suspects.name: Arthur Finch
suspects.bio: Eleanor's estranged nephew, recently 'volunteering' at the shelter. Known for his keen interest in Eleanor's finances and quick temper.
suspects.personality_style: Shifty, resentful, trying to appear helpful
knowledge_sentences: I was feeding the nocturnal bats and owls in the East Wing from 18:00 to 19:00; it's a messy job.
Around 20:00, I spoke with Clara Bellweather about some overdue bills for the animal feed suppliers in the main reception.
I walked past Eleanor's office at 21:00 and heard her on the phone; she sounded very animated, almost yelling.
I entered Eleanor's office around 22:00 to ask about my work schedule, but she seemed preoccupied, mentioning 'legal documents' and waving me away.
I saw Dr. Petrova heading towards the surgical suite around 19:30; she always looks so stern and focused.
That ornate dog leash in Eleanor's office? I always thought it was a bit ostentatious, but she loved it. A gift, I think.
Eleanor was a difficult woman, always threatening to change her will if anyone stepped out of line. I overheard her talking to someone about removing 'someone completely' from a will.
I left her office around 22:30, I remember glancing at the clock, and went straight to my staff apartment.
I saw Clara leave the main reception around 21:30, she seemed to be tidying up.

timeline.18:00: Feeding nocturnal animals in the East Wing.
timeline.19:00: In the staff break room, looking at the donor board.
timeline.20:00: Talking to Clara in the main reception about shelter finances.
timeline.21:00: Walking past Eleanor's office, heard her on the phone.
timeline.23:00: Left Eleanor's office and went quickly to his staff apartment.
timeline.00:00: In his staff apartment, trying to sleep.

suspects.defense_statement: This is outrageous! I would never hurt Eleanor, despite our disagreements. You have no proof!
suspects.fallback_statement: I'm afraid I don't recall that detail right now. It was a long night.

suspects.name: Dr. Lena Petrova
suspects.bio: The dedicated head veterinarian, known for her unwavering commitment to animal welfare, often clashing with Eleanor over budget decisions.
knowledge_sentences: I was in my office until 19:00, reviewing post-operative charts, then moved to the surgical suite to organize for tomorrow's operations.
Around 20:30, I checked on Barkley, the recovering poodle, in the recovery ward; he's had a rough week.
I had a solitary dinner in the staff break room around 21:00. No one else was there; it was unusually quiet.
I distinctly heard a loud, angry male voice from Eleanor's office around 22:15. It sounded like a heated argument.
I saw Arthur Finch hurrying away from the administrative wing around 22:45; he looked incredibly agitated.
Eleanor and I had a significant disagreement earlier about funding Barkley's expensive MRI. She was incredibly stubborn and short-sighted.
Clara Bellweather seemed to be cleaning the main reception area around 21:00; I saw her through the glass panel.
I don't concern myself with office politics or wills, only the welfare of these animals. That was my only focus.
The ceremonial leash? I think it was given to Eleanor by some wealthy donor years ago. Ostentatious, not practical.

timeline.18:00: Reviewing post-operative charts in her office.
timeline.19:00: In the surgical suite, preparing for a morning procedure.
timeline.20:00: Checking on the recovering poodle, Barkley, in the recovery ward.
timeline.21:00: Had a quick dinner in the staff break room.
timeline.22:00: Back in the surgical suite, organizing instruments.
timeline.23:00: In her office, making notes for the morning.
timeline.00:00: Left the building and drove home.

suffixes: . My focus is on the animals.
. That is all I can tell you.
suspects.defense_statement: Preposterous! My dedication is to these animals, not to any human drama. You are wasting valuable time that could be spent on real leads.
suspects.fallback_statement: I'm sorry, I cannot provide a definitive answer for that.

suspects.name: Clara Bellweather
suspects.bio: Long-time shelter volunteer and Eleanor's personal assistant. Often gossipy but fiercely loyal to the sanctuary.
suspects.personality_style: Overly eager, a bit gossipy, resentful
knowledge_sentences: I finished filing invoices in the main office around 19:00, then went to polish the donor plaque in the reception area.
Arthur Finch and I talked about the shelter's finances near the main reception around 20:00. He seemed very interested in money matters.
I saw Eleanor storm into her office around 20:30, muttering something about 'ungrateful people' under her breath.
Around 21:00, I was watering the large ficus in the main hall. It gets so dry this time of year.
I heard raised voices from Eleanor's office just before 22:30. It definitely sounded like a man and Eleanor, arguing fiercely.
Eleanor told me she was planning to meet with her lawyer tomorrow morning to amend her will. She said she was 'making some drastic changes'.
I saw Dr. Petrova leave the staff break room around 21:30, looking as stern as ever, and head towards her office.
Arthur seemed particularly agitated earlier in the evening, asking me about Eleanor's schedule for tomorrow and if she had any visitors.
The leash? Oh, that was a gift from the late Mr. Henderson, the shelter's biggest benefactor before Eleanor took over. It was very valuable.

timeline.18:00: Finishing administrative paperwork in the main office.
timeline.19:00: Tidying up the donor wall in the reception area.
timeline.20:00: Speaking with Arthur Finch in the reception area.
timeline.21:00: Watering the plants in the main hall.
timeline.22:00: In her staff apartment, reading a book.
timeline.23:00: Still in her staff apartment, getting ready for bed.

suffixes: . My heart goes out to Eleanor.
suspects.defense_statement: Me? Kill Eleanor? Never! She could be difficult, yes, but I would never harm a soul, let alone a human!
suspects.fallback_statement: I'm not entirely sure about that, my memory isn't what it used to be.
